pullRequest.title: Fix #2223 and #6008: PhotoCam error handling improvements and device selection
pullRequest.bodyText:
Hi,
this PR is intended to fix #2223 and #6008 .
In a nutshell:

p:photocam has a new attribute device to set up the desired device id. In mobiles, "user" stands for the front camera and "environment" stands for the rear camera. This terminology comes from browser media API which can be consulted here: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaDevices/getUserMedia

Some prints below (Safari/iOS 13.2) from my tests:


In my experiments, this feature also worked on Chrome/FF (android 9)

The PhotoCam widget has a new devices attribute. When the page loads, as soon as possible, browser populates devices attribute with native InputDeviceInfo objects. The specific device id for a suposing USB camera attached to the computer can be obtained by this collection. The example below shows PhotoCam using a logitech USB camera.



It is introduced an onCameraError fallback which can be used to override the default alert-based error handler mechanism, as asked in #2223 .

I would like to add some notes for future research:


By my tests, PF 8 PhotoCam doesn't work as expected in Chrome/Firefox on iOS devices although this same component runs fine in Safari on IOs. I found that it is not a specific issue of PF PhotoCam but something up to Apple as discussed here: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/29160819/how-to-use-getusermedia-in-chrome-for-ios/45454817 .


Chrome denies usage of camera devices without HTTPS if the request is not to/from localhost. This can be a little problematic to test the component on mobile browsers or even a remote PC. Even tough a tricy chrome configuration can loosen this restriction, for development purposes a self-signed https certificate should do the job.


I'm inclined to think that upgrading PhotoCam to HTML5 only after Apple finishes the getUserMedia support would be the best thing to do.


Neither PF 8 PhotoCam nor the code in this PR run on Internet Explorer 11.

commit.message: + video input device list & seletion AND custom error handling
avoiding namespace absence in Webcam.Error errorObj doc
fix param type on ts doc

nodes.bodyText: Suggests a video input devices such as 'user' (aka font camera) or 'environment' (aka rear camera).
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -44,6 +44,8 @@ photoHeight | 240 | Integer | Height of the captured photo, defaults to height.
 format | jpeg | Boolean | Format of the image, valid values are "jpeg" default and png.
 jpegQuality | 90 | Integer | Quality of the image between 0 and 100 when the format is jpeg, default value is 90.
 forceFlash | false | Boolean | Enables always using flash fallback even in an HTML5 environment.
+device | false | String | Suggests a video input device.

Client side callback executed if the camera has an error.

commit.message: fixing case of reload function doc description
added Browser Compatibility section to docs

nodes.bodyText: PhotoCam does not support Microsoft Internet Explorer 11 or below. Other legacy browsers are also not likely to be functional.
Just this one last wording change above...

commit.message: Microsoft Internet Explorer 11 support text rewriting

nodes.bodyText:
Just a quick note regarding the types: As far as I can tell from the name and how it's used, the type of errorObj should probably be Error instead of () => void. Cross-checking with the source code of PhotoCam, WebcamError and FlashError inherit from the builtin Error class.
Also, you can use @private to mark a method as private. Since this is an internally used callback, it qualifies in my opinion.

commit.message: rewriting devices attrb as getAvailableDevices function

nodes.bodyText: Lambdas are nice and easier to write, but unfortunately not supported by all target browsers yet, and not used anywhere else in the codebase afaik. Can you change that to function(devices) { ... }

This is a little bit pedantic, but TypeScript types allow us to be explicit about the nullness of values (personally I prefer to use undefined in favor of null, but I don't think there's any consensus on that, so it's fine as it is):

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                 *  @return {Promise<InputDeviceInfo[]>} Returns a promise to resolve the enumeration or null if the browser doesn't support media devices enumeration
          
          
            
                 *  @return {Promise<InputDeviceInfo[]> | null} Returns a promise to resolve the enumeration or `null` if the browser does not support media devices enumeration.
          
      
    
    
  

But other than that, the JavaScript docs look pretty good : ) I'm glad it's being maintained by everybody now.

Could you add the new properties of the widget configuration to the JavaScript docs around line 1073? Like this:
 * @prop {string} cfg.device Suggests a video input device such as `user` (font camera) or `environment` (rear camera).
 * @prop {string} cfg.onCameraError Client side callback executed if the camera has an error. This string must be valid
 * JavaScript code. It is executed within the context of a function with a single parameter `errorObj` of type `Error`.
